meta.description: Espaco Banco Safra at Sao Paulo–Guarulhos International Airport (GRU), Terminal 3. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Espaco Banco Safra

location.terminalDirections: After Passport Control, take the escalator or elevator up to the Mezzanine Level above the Duty Free Area.

lounge.description: A world of comfort and relaxation awaits at Espaco Banco Safra. Take refuge from the noise and crowds in the terminal, and enjoy a wide range of amenities designed to ease your travel pains.

general: Children 2 years old and under are admitted free with an adult.

Access for Priority Pass, Lounge Key, Lounge Club, and Diners Club cardholders is available between these hours: 7:00 am - 3:00 am Saturday - Wednesday, 7:00 am - 3:00 pm and 9:00 pm - 3:00 am Thursday - Friday.
warning: Maximum 6-hours stay for Priority Pass and other lounge membership guests.
regulatory: This lounge is accessible for Terminal 3 International departures and arrivals only.
Access is permitted 2 hours prior to scheduled flight departure.

reviews.content: It’s the best GRU lounge in my opinion, the service is impeccable, the shower is excellent but still has room to food improvement.
Love your service! My travel life got much more comfortable thanks to you.
Doesn’t take Priority Pass most of the time, even though they are not that busy.
The best lounge in GRU, buffet salad, soup, some protein, wines, electrical outlets... etc...
Always crowded. The Mastercard is waaay better if you have access.
Nice, open, has everything you’d expect and it’s clean.
Great food. Amazing drinks. Bartender that prepares cocktail. Nice "brigadeiro" dessert. Champagne, beers, soft drinks. Very large room, nicely decorated.
Very nice lounge. You can find snacks, fresh fruits and hot meals! Great choice.
Very nice lounge with great food and drink options. Clean and spacious, modern design. Recommended!
Excellent lounge. Great food options, very good drinks selection, cocktail menu free. Nice and diverse interior design and seating options. Service is 5 star quality!
This is the best Lounge in GRU.
On Sundays, they don’t accept Priority Pass until 8:30PM, but AMEX Platinum holders can access the lounge. Good food and drink selections.
A nice lounge for all the Star Alliance flights out there. Sometimes it does get pretty crowded.
Great lounge at Guarulhos! The food selection is extensive (cold cuts, hot meals and more), various differentiated seating options and areas. Quite busy on a Friday evening but handled well by staff.
Not accepting AMEX Corporate Platinum cards.
Entered at 8am and was nearly empty. Lots of comfortable seating, but no champagne in the morning and weak buffet.
Entered this lounge with PP around 8:15am. Mostly empty. Hot breakfast available. Seats are comfortable. Outlets everywhere. No more than 60-70 seats, so I can imagine it filling up in busy hour.
Tried to enter this lounge 3x with Priority Pass, have always been systematically denied access. Last time asked the lady at front desk about the rules, she told me PP users can only enter after 9pm.
Comfortable sitting, good internet, nice food and beverages, good booze. Has shower and ample business center. Recommended.
Nice lounge and relatively comfortable. I can see that it could get crowded. Only 220v outlets and USB charging. Food pretty good and hot veggie options. Self serve bar with decent champagne.
Very nice lounge, there is nice food for lunch and drinks. It is a bit crowded in the evening but it is the go-to lounge for PP card holders.
Shower is free with Star Alliance business class, American Express Platinum; and otherwise $20 with Priority Pass, Diner's Club, etc.
Decent lounge that can get busy in the evening. Only Brazil plug outlets and USB charging. (Not all the USB outlets work). Nicer than some of the other lounges and has some decent food and drinks.
Great place to stay and pass time in São Paulo lay off.
Comida escassa e com apresentação ruim.
Impecable el salón, amplio, cuidado y con excelente servicio.
Large lounge has more than enough seating to go around. The snack size bites are great for a small meal and the drink selection is superb. Highly recommend.
Excelente. Bebidas, vino, champaña y café. También una deliciosa sopa de tomates
The lounge is always crowded and you will likely have to wait for a shower. Wifi is also slow but the food and drinks are OK.
Beautiful lounge with solid food and comfortable chairs. The shower costs extra but if you don't need a shower this is best.
Shower suites were amazing. Food and beverage selection was nice - no bartender, but ability to pour your own. Overall pretty amazing and spacious!
Good food and a nice, open air space to relax. No boarding announcements, though.
The shower costs USD20 and they don't call you for your flight. All service is like self service type. The rest is really good.
Food is very limited, showers cost $20 USD, everything else is very good.
Big area, full of comfortable and different spaces. Bathroom and shower facilities are top-notch. Got in with Priority Pass.
Hands down the nicest looking lounge I've been in.  Very very spacious.  Food selection is pretty basic but it's delicious.  Plenty of electrical outlets.  Great service.
El lounge es muy bello y moderno. Tiene una decoración muy elegante. Es bastante amplio y tiene muchos asientos para relajarse. Las opciones de comida son muy reducidas.
Design is beautiful but food and drink offerings are lackluster for a Star Alliance hub. Quality of wine is poor, especially in South America with such great wines! Food options are basic.
Very crowded on Sunday night, especially underwhelming for first class passengers. Food and drink, glasses and dinnerware weren't refilled quickly. Wi-Fi was average. Expected bigger space from Star.
Wifi slow or fast depending on days. Foods and drinks ok. Showers are great, but sometimes there is waitlist.
Very nice, especially compared to United Club lounges. Soup was excellent! Wines and alcohol available for free.
Excellent lounge. Well designed and functional. Food is OK, but service is great, and so are the views of the tarmac. Nice shower facilities.
Not a good lounge this is supposed to be the premier lounge for Star Alliance not even close to Buenos Aires lounge.
As others have mentioned, good food, wine selection is limited, but not bad. Modern spacious feel, good internet and electrical outlets. Furniture looks good, but not very comfortable or functional.
Beautiful and brand new lounge in terminal 3. Pasta, salad, sandwiches, snacks, desserts. Wines and good selection of alcohol. It was full, but many places to sit, loved it!

Fancy design; spacious and clean; decent hot food and drink selection. However, not too many wine options. Staff is very nice. Simple, but nice shower room. Overall, a top-notch lounge in South America.
Recently opened, good size, with tasty snacks and drinks. Comfortable seating and fast WIFI. Great showers too, and helpful staff!

location.terminalDirections: Mezzanine Level, 3rd Floor, above the Duty Free shopping area
After Passport Control, turn left and walk through the Duty Free. The bar is located on the 2nd Level near Gates 301-304. International flights only.
After passport control and security check, the lounge is located near gates 301 and 302.
After passport control, turn left and the lounge is located on the ground floor.
After the Security Checkpoint and Passport Control, turn left and follow the signs to the 'VIP Lounges'.
Located after Passport Control in the Transit Area, 1st Floor on the right hand side.
Located in the departure area on the ground floor, along the corridor to the left while walking to the departure gates.
After security, the lounge is located at the end of the pier on the right hand side, near the Boarding Gates.
After Security Control, Central Area, opposite Duty Free.
